intro: Bupleurum brasianum, commonly known as Brazilian angelica, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branching stems and compound leaves with a distinctive fern-like appearance. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Bupleurum brasianum is often found in moist, shady habitats such as forests and stream banks.
